text.section: The Howard County Board of License Commissioners may issue a special wine festival (WF) license.

Notwithstanding any other provision to the contrary, an applicant for a special WF license shall be a holder of an existing retail alcoholic beverages license issued in the State and authorized under the license to sell wine, State Class 3 winery license, or State Class 4 winery license issued pursuant to this article.
A special WF licensee shall only display and sell wine that is produced and processed in Maryland.

A special WF license entitles the holder to display and sell at retail wine for consumption on or off the licensed premises on the days and for the hours designated for the wine festival in Howard County.

The Howard County Board of License Commissioners:
Except for the dates chosen for the Cumberland and Shenandoah Valley Wine Festival in Washington County, the Maryland Wine Festival in Carroll County, the Baltimore County Wine Festival, and the Anne Arundel County Beer and Wine Festival, shall approve one weekend annually for the wine festival; and
Shall approve a location in Howard County for this festival which does not hold an alcoholic beverages license.
The Howard County Board of License Commissioners shall adopt regulations for implementing this section.
